EVSC's free summer meal program expands to fill the need
By Jared Council Evansville Courier&Press Posted July 5, 2010 at 11:37 p.m.
Discuss Print A A A
Article Highlights
The Evansville Vanderburgh School Corp.'s Summer Food Service Program served 4,122 lunches in its first year Last summer it served nearly 57,000
DENNY SIMMONS / Courier&Press Isaac Ruckriegel, 6, eats another french fry after eating two burgers to go with his two milks at Tekoppel Elementary School's cafeteria on June 29. The Evansville Vanderburgh School Corp.'s summer lunch program at Tekoppel feeds more than 200 participants each day.
EVANSVILLE — Since its inception, the function of the Evansville Vanderburgh School Corp.'s Summer Food Service Program has been consistent: Provide free, nutritious meals to anyone 18 and younger.
Zoe Williams, 7, is entertained by her brother, Simon, 5, as he blows bubbles in his chocolate milk in Tekoppel Elementary School's cafeteria on June 29.
Summer lunch still available
The Evansville Vanderburgh School Corp. invites community agencies, organizations and families to any of these sites between 11:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. until July 23:
n Caze Elementary
